title: Shelf stable sausages
selftext: So, I am in charge of feeding 3 meals per child to about 40 kids for three days each. This is run on donations from the community in a community of about a thousand. The “meals” must be shelf stable and require no more cooking than a microwave and that’s to be avoided if possible. We’re talking feeding 3 each breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snack items to 40ish homeless or impoverished kids from 3-15 years of age for three days each. To the point of the post, I have access to a state approved kitchen and to a source of farm fresh meat and a usda butcher. How can I make small hotdog type sausages that are shelf stable for these kids to guarantee them some healthy protein?
